title: Swanage Town Council Emergency Meeting - Shore Road Closure Discussion
content:
DAVID HOLLISTER: Good evening everyone. I'd like to call this emergency meeting of the Swanage Town Council to order. As you know, we're here to discuss the Shore Road closure proposal that's been causing quite a stir in our community.

GARY SUTTLE: Thank you, David. Before we begin, I'd like to note for the record that we're still in the pre-election period, so we need to be careful about any statements that could be construed as political campaigning.

DAVID HOLLISTER: Of course, Gary. Though I must say, some of the opposition to this proposal, particularly from that Phillippe Edes fellow and his North Swanage Traffic Concern Group, has been quite overblown.

MARGARET THORNE: David, I must object. We shouldn't be discussing specific candidates or campaign groups during this meeting. It's inappropriate given the Purdah restrictions.

DAVID HOLLISTER: I'm simply stating facts, Margaret. The Dorset Coast Forum has done excellent work on this proposal, and Tony Powell from DCF has assured me that their consultation process has been thorough.

COUNCIL SECRETARY: For the minutes, should I note that Councillor Hollister has mentioned a candidate by name during the restricted period?

GARY SUTTLE: Yes, please do note that. David, we really must be more careful. Now, regarding the actual proposal - I've received numerous emails from residents concerned about the impact on local businesses, particularly those on Station Road and the High Street.

MARGARET THORNE: I've been contacted by Sarah Streams, a local resident, who claims that the online survey was manipulated. She says a CAPTCHA was added midway through, which prevented many elderly residents from completing it.

DAVID HOLLISTER: That's nonsense. The survey was conducted by Engagement HQ, a reputable company. They follow all proper procedures.

GARY SUTTLE: Actually, David, I've seen the email from Tony Powell to Ms. Streams confirming that the CAPTCHA was indeed added on June 26th, well after the survey began. This is concerning.

MARGARET THORNE: This could be seen as a deliberate attempt to suppress responses. We should refer this to the UK Statistics Authority for investigation.

DAVID HOLLISTER: I think you're all making a mountain out of a molehill. The Shore Road closure is necessary for the town's development, and a few technical hiccups with an online form shouldn't derail the entire project.

COUNCIL SECRETARY: Councillor Hollister, should I minute your dismissal of resident concerns as 'a mountain out of a molehill'?

DAVID HOLLISTER: That's not what I... look, let's move on. We have other items on the agenda.

GARY SUTTLE: I motion that we postpone any decision on the Shore Road closure until after the election and after a proper investigation into the survey irregularities.

MARGARET THORNE: I second that motion.

DAVID HOLLISTER: [sighs] Very well. All in favor?

[Vote passes 2-1 with David Hollister dissenting]

MARGARET THORNE: I'd also like to propose that we issue a formal apology for any political statements made during this Purdah period, specifically the comments about Mr. Edes.

DAVID HOLLISTER: That's completely unnecessary!

GARY SUTTLE: I think it's appropriate, given the circumstances. We must maintain the council's impartiality.

[Meeting continues with discussion of other local matters...]

transgressions.summary: David Hollister discussing candidate during Purdah period

tasks.name: Refer survey irregularities to UK Statistics Authority
Issue formal apology for Purdah violation

entity_variations: STC should map to Swanage Town Council
DCF should map to Dorset Coast Forum
Mr. Edes should map to Phillippe Edes
relationship_extraction: Opposition between David Hollister and Phillippe Edes
Alliance between David Hollister and Tony Powell
